title: Leading Putin critic Alexei Navalny says he may face life sentence
description: Imprisoned Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny said Wednesday that he was facing new extremism and terrorism charges that could keep him behind bars for life, as authorities set the stage for a new trial against the Kremlin’s leading critic.

title: Senior Iranian cleric gunned down by armed guard at bank
description: An armed guard at a bank in northern Iran calmly walked up behind a senior Shiite cleric and shot and killed the ayatollah on Wednesday.

title: Remains of Medal of Honor recipient killed in the Korean War identified nearly 73 years later
description: The remains of a U.S. Army corporal killed during the Korean War have been identified 73 years after he was declared missing and was awarded the Medal of Honor for bravery, U.S. and South Korean officials said Wednesday.

title: Gunfire heard amid Sudan ceasefire, reports say
description: Foreign countries are scrambling to evacuate their citizens from Sudan during a fragile ceasefire amid reports of sporadic gunfire and explosions in parts of Khartoum. NBC News’ Richard Engel breaks down whether Sudan’s army or the Rapid Support Forces are willing to negotiate and what role the U.S. could play in a truce between the two sides.

title: China's Xi talks with Ukraine's Zelenskyy by phone for the first time since Russia's invasion
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping appealed for negotiations between Russia and Ukraine in a phone call Wednesday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, warning “there is no winner in a nuclear war,” state media said.

title: Singapore executes citizen for coordinating delivery of 2.2 pounds of cannabis
description: Singapore executed a man accused of coordinating a cannabis delivery, despite pleas for clemency and protests that he was convicted on weak evidence.

title: Death toll rises as Kenyan cult investigation unearths more bodies
description: The death toll among followers of a Kenyan cult who believed they would go to heaven if they starved themselves has risen to 89, authorities said, amid ongoing exhumations in an 800-acre area where the self-proclaimed Good News International Church was based.

title: War crimes suspect free from prison in chaos of Sudan conflict
description: A former high-ranking Sudanese official wanted for war crimes says he has been freed from prison as the conflict between warring generals fuels chaos and uncertainty over the whereabouts of the country's deposed dictator.

title: Kenyan hunger cult deaths reach 89, officials hope survivors will ‘tell the story’
description: The death toll among followers of a Kenyan cult who believed they would go to heaven if they starved themselves has risen to 89.

title: Dozens of bodies float ashore in Libya after migrant boats sink
description: At least 57 bodies have been washed ashore after two migrant boats sank in the Mediterranean off different towns in western Libya, a coast guard officer and an aid worker said on Tuesday.

title: Japanese company says moon lander unexpectedly accelerated and likely crashed
description: A Japanese company’s spacecraft apparently crashed while attempting to land on the moon Wednesday, losing contact moments before touchdown and sending flight controllers scrambling to figure out what happened.

title: Jacinda Ardern, former New Zealand prime minister, to join Harvard
description: Former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern will be temporarily joining Harvard University later this year, Kennedy School Dean Douglas Elmendorf said Tuesday.
